subject: Re: [junit] Why is MethodRule deprecated, and what's the alternative?
msgSnippet: thaneanthem, You may have more luck looking at the released code (http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/tree/r4.8.2).  Documentation at HEAD is lagging a bit, as
messageBody:
thaneanthem,

You may have more luck looking at the released code
(http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/tree/r4.8.2). Documentation at HEAD
is lagging a bit, as the implementation settles down. TestRule is the
current proposed replacement for MethodRule, and we'll write it up
better if it proves an improvement.

David Saff

On Sat, Oct 30, 2010 at 6:43 PM, thaneanthem <thaneanthem@...> wrote:
> In my efforts to understand @Rule, I see that MethodRule is deprecated, but I have not been able to find any explanation for the deprecation, or suggestions for what to use instead of MethodRule.
>
> Does anyone know why MethodRule is deprecated, and what the alternative is?
>
> Thank you,
>
> -Thane
>
